contextId.information: A shekel is a unit of weight equal to about 11 grams. AT: "about 11 grams of silver" or "one silver coin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]])
A shekel is a unit of weight equal to about 11 grams. AT: "about 11 grams of silver" or "one silver coin"(See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]])
You may convert this to a modern measure. AT: "six hundred grams of silver" or "three-fifths of a kilogram of silver" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]])
This is the name of type of weight that was used for money. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]])
A talent was about 33 kilograms. AT: "3,300 kilograms ... 33 kilograms" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]])
